intro: Leobordea maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan leobordea, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss, a feature common in xerophytic plants. Leobordea maroccana is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
